name: MLMediaSource
desc: The MLMediaSource class identifies a specific provider of media. Conceptually, a media source respresents a single app, such as iTunes or Aperture. Each media source contains multiple groups of media objectsâ€”individual files containing a piece of media such as a photo, song, or movie.

items.name: var mediaSourceIdentifier: String
items.desc: A unique identifier for the media source.

items.name: var mediaLibrary: MLMediaLibrary?
items.desc: A pointer to the media library instance that loaded this media source.

items.name: var attributes: [String : Any]
items.desc: A list of attributes describing the media source.

items.name: var rootMediaGroup: MLMediaGroup?
items.desc: The base media group in the media source that contains all other groups within the source as descendant elements.

items.name: func mediaGroup(forIdentifier: String) -> MLMediaGroup?
items.desc: Returns the media group with the specified identifier.

items.name: func mediaGroups(forIdentifiers: [String]) -> [String : MLMediaGroup]
items.desc: Returns the media groups with the specified identifiers.

items.name: func mediaObject(forIdentifier: String) -> MLMediaObject?
items.desc: Returns the media object with the specified identifier.

items.name: func mediaObjects(forIdentifiers: [String]) -> [String : MLMediaObject]
items.desc: Returns the media objects with the specified identifiers.
